name: Not more than four colours
desc: The chart must not contain more than four colors for its shapes.

name: Use an appropriate caption
desc: The caption must accurately describe the contents of the chart.

name: Comprehension doesn't hinge on colour perception
desc: The graph must be able to be understood even if turned black and white. No information must be conveyed solely through colour.

name: Adequate contrast between text and background
desc: The text colour must contrast the background as per WCAG 2 1.4.3 Contrast

name: No elements of distraction in data
desc: Distracting patterns in data must be avoided. Any element that does not make the data easier to undertand should be avoided.

name: Text direction in line with user reading direction
desc: The text must flow in the direction the user's eye is accustomed to.

name: Colour palette suited to colour blind users.
desc: The colour palette must not include combinations of colours which make it harder to read for colour blind users.

name: Object size consistent with importance of data portrayed
desc: An object's size must be consistent with the importance of the data it portrays. Objects with the same level of importance must be of the same size.

name: Simple and natural language
desc: Language must be as simple and clear as possible, accounting for difference of backgrounds and education in users. A simple explanation must be preferred to a more thorough one when the latter would potentially harm the user's understanding.

name: No 3D displays
desc: 3D visualization of data augments visual noise without enriching the user's understanding, and thus must be avoided.

name: No excessive details in data labels
desc: Too much data in labels overloads the user's memory and hinders comprehension, so it must be avoided.
